chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Praise ye the LORD. O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.
items.plainText: Praise ye the LORD. O give thanks unto the LORD; for he is good: for his mercy endureth for ever.

items.text: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? who can shew forth all his praise?
items.plainText: Who can utter the mighty acts of the LORD? who can shew forth all his praise?

items.text: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.
items.plainText: Blessed are they that keep judgment, and he that doeth righteousness at all times.

items.text: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;
items.plainText: Remember me, O LORD, with the favour that thou bearest unto thy people: O visit me with thy salvation;

items.text: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.
items.plainText: That I may see the good of thy chosen, that I may rejoice in the gladness of thy nation, that I may glory with thine inheritance.

items.text: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.
items.plainText: We have sinned with our fathers, we have committed iniquity, we have done wickedly.

items.text: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.
items.plainText: Our fathers understood not thy wonders in Egypt; they remembered not the multitude of thy mercies; but provoked him at the sea, even at the Red sea.

items.text: Nevertheless he saved them for his name's sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.
items.plainText: Nevertheless he saved them for his name's sake, that he might make his mighty power to be known.

items.text: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.
items.plainText: He rebuked the Red sea also, and it was dried up: so he led them through the depths, as through the wilderness.

items.text: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.
items.plainText: And he saved them from the hand of him that hated them, and redeemed them from the hand of the enemy.

items.text: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.
items.plainText: And the waters covered their enemies: there was not one of them left.

items.text: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.
items.plainText: Then believed they his words; they sang his praise.

items.text: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:
items.plainText: They soon forgat his works; they waited not for his counsel:

items.text: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.
items.plainText: But lusted exceedingly in the wilderness, and tempted God in the desert.

items.text: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.
items.plainText: And he gave them their request; but sent leanness into their soul.

items.text: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.
items.plainText: They envied Moses also in the camp, and Aaron the saint of the LORD.

items.text: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.
items.plainText: The earth opened and swallowed up Dathan, and covered the company of Abiram.

items.text: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.
items.plainText: And a fire was kindled in their company; the flame burned up the wicked.

items.text: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.
items.plainText: They made a calf in Horeb, and worshipped the molten image.

items.text: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.
items.plainText: Thus they changed their glory into the similitude of an ox that eateth grass.

items.text: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;
items.plainText: They forgat God their saviour, which had done great things in Egypt;

items.text: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.
items.plainText: Wondrous works in the land of Ham, and terrible things by the Red sea.

items.text: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.
items.plainText: Therefore he said that he would destroy them, had not Moses his chosen stood before him in the breach, to turn away his wrath, lest he should destroy them.

items.text: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:
items.plainText: Yea, they despised the pleasant land, they believed not his word:

items.text: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.
items.plainText: But murmured in their tents, and hearkened not unto the voice of the LORD.

items.text: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:
items.plainText: Therefore he lifted up his hand against them, to overthrow them in the wilderness:

items.text: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.
items.plainText: To overthrow their seed also among the nations, and to scatter them in the lands.

items.text: They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.
items.plainText: They joined themselves also unto Baal-peor, and ate the sacrifices of the dead.

items.text: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.
items.plainText: Thus they provoked him to anger with their inventions: and the plague brake in upon them.

items.text: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.
items.plainText: Then stood up Phinehas, and executed judgment: and so the plague was stayed.

items.text: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.
items.plainText: And that was counted unto him for righteousness unto all generations for evermore.

items.text: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:
items.plainText: They angered him also at the waters of strife, so that it went ill with Moses for their sakes:

items.text: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.
items.plainText: Because they provoked his spirit, so that he spake unadvisedly with his lips.

items.text: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:
items.plainText: They did not destroy the nations, concerning whom the LORD commanded them:

items.text: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.
items.plainText: But were mingled among the heathen, and learned their works.

items.text: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.
items.plainText: And they served their idols: which were a snare unto them.

items.text: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,
items.plainText: Yea, they sacrificed their sons and their daughters unto devils,

items.text: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.
items.plainText: And shed innocent blood, even the blood of their sons and of their daughters, whom they sacrificed unto the idols of Canaan: and the land was polluted with blood.

items.text: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.
items.plainText: Thus were they defiled with their own works, and went a whoring with their own inventions.

items.text: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.
items.plainText: Therefore was the wrath of the LORD kindled against his people, insomuch that he abhorred his own inheritance.

items.text: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.
items.plainText: And he gave them into the hand of the heathen; and they that hated them ruled over them.

items.text: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.
items.plainText: Their enemies also oppressed them, and they were brought into subjection under their hand.

items.text: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.
items.plainText: Many times did he deliver them; but they provoked him with their counsel, and were brought low for their iniquity.

items.text: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:
items.plainText: Nevertheless he regarded their affliction, when he heard their cry:

items.text: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.
items.plainText: And he remembered for them his covenant, and repented according to the multitude of his mercies.

items.text: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.
items.plainText: He made them also to be pitied of all those that carried them captives.

items.text: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.
items.plainText: Save us, O LORD our God, and gather us from among the heathen, to give thanks unto thy holy name, and to triumph in thy praise.

items.text: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the LORD.
items.plainText: Blessed be the LORD God of Israel from everlasting to everlasting: and let all the people say, Amen. Praise ye the LORD.
